revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject United States|class=B|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Biography |class=B |living=no |military-work-group=y |military-priority=low |listas=Lee, Kurt Chew-Een }} {{WikiProject California|class B}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=B|US=yes|Biography=yes |B-Class-1=y |B-Class-2=y |B-Class-3=y |B-Class-4=y |B-Class-5=y }} }} {{dyktalk|10 December|2011|entry=... that after earning the [[Navy Cross]] and getting wounded in combat, Lieutenant '''[[Kurt Chew-Een Lee]]''' took a Jeep and returned to the battle arena with his arm in a sling?}} == Chinese Character Edits == The persistent inclusion of 三姓家奴 is vandalism; the machine translation for Chinese is terrible, but it's a derogatory reference that comes from Romance of the Three Kingdoms, in relation to a person in the book whose surname is the same Chinese character as the US Marine's. You can see the entry on Baidu here http://baike.baidu.com/view/388490.htm. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/18.186.7.166|18.186.7.166]] ([[User talk:18.186.7.166|talk]]) 15:31, 16 March 2014 (UTC) LOL some Chinese did that I guess — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/131.151.111.44|131.151.111.44]] ([[User talk:131.151.111.44|talk]]) 22:02, 15 May 2014 (UTC) == Date of death == Lee died on Monday, see these sources: [http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/06/us/major-lee-marines/ CNN], [http://www.sacbee.com/2014/03/06/6212314/editorial-a-marine-who-grew-up.html Sacramento Bee], [http://www.marinecorpstimes.com/article/20140305/NEWS/303170011/Maj-Kurt-Lee-Korean-War-hero-dies-88 Marine Corps Times], [http://wtkr.com/2014/03/06/major-kurt-chew-een-lee-asian-american-marines-trailblazer-dies-at-88/ WTKR], among several others. I have moved his date of death and will shortly move his listing on the [[Deaths in 2014]] page. – [[User talk:TCMemoire|T]][[Special:Contributions/TCMemoire|C]][[User:TCMemoire|Memoire]] 20:29, 6 March 2014 (UTC) == Removed text == Major Lee's Funeral Services and Memorial took place at Arlington National Cemetery at 11:00 AM Tuesday, Sept. 30th. 2014 With Full Honors. Claims in this Article of First non-White Officer, and First Chinese/American Officer of the Marine Corps, are in Dispute. Wilbur C. Sze Chinese/American, was Commissioned an Officer of the Marine Corps, on Dec. 15th 1943. Frederick C. Branch African/American, was Commissioned an Officer of the Marine Corps on Nov. 10th 1945. [[user:220 of Borg|'''220''']] [[Special:Contributions/220 of Borg|''of'']] [[User talk:220 of Borg|''Borg'']] 12:40, 18 August 2016 (UTC)
